name: Aconcagua
hint: Highest peak in the Americas and the Southern Hemisphere, in Argentina

name: Ojos del Salado
hint: Highest volcano in the world, on the Argentina-Chile border

name: Monte Pissis
hint: Third-highest peak in the Western Hemisphere, an extinct volcano in Argentina

name: Huascaran
hint: Highest mountain in Peru, in the Cordillera Blanca

name: Chimborazo
hint: Highest peak in Ecuador, farthest point from Earth's center due to equatorial bulge

name: Cotopaxi
hint: One of the highest active volcanoes in the world, in Ecuador

name: Illimani
hint: Highest peak near La Paz, Bolivia, dominant feature of the city skyline

name: Pico Bolivar
hint: Highest mountain in Venezuela, in the Sierra Nevada de Merida

name: Mount Roraima
hint: Famous tabletop mountain at the junction of Venezuela, Brazil, and Guyana

name: Fitz Roy
hint: Iconic jagged peak in Patagonia, on the Argentina-Chile border

name: Cerro Torre
hint: Famously difficult needle-like granite peak in Patagonia, near Fitz Roy

name: Nevado Sajama
hint: Highest peak in Bolivia, an extinct stratovolcano on the Chilean border

name: Nevado del Ruiz
hint: Active volcano in Colombia whose 1985 eruption tragically buried the town of Armero

name: Osorno Volcano
hint: Perfectly cone-shaped stratovolcano in Chile's Lake District, nicknamed 'the Fuji of South America'

name: Pico da Neblina
hint: Highest mountain in Brazil, near the Venezuelan border, often shrouded in mist

name: Torres del Paine
hint: Stunning granite towers in Chile's most famous national park in Patagonia

name: Tupungato
hint: Stratovolcano on the Argentina-Chile border, one of the highest in the Andes

name: Nevado Mismi
hint: Peruvian peak identified as the ultimate source of the Amazon River

name: Cordillera Blanca
hint: World's highest tropical mountain range in Peru, with over 50 peaks above 5700m

name: Misti Volcano
hint: Symmetrical active volcano towering over the Peruvian city of Arequipa

name: Yerupaja
hint: Second-highest mountain in Peru, in the remote Cordillera Huayhuash

name: Villarrica Volcano
hint: One of Chile's most active volcanoes, popular for climbing with a lava lake at its summit

name: Nevado Huila
hint: Highest active volcano in Colombia, a stratovolcano in the Central Cordillera

name: Auyan-tepui
hint: Massive tabletop mountain in Venezuela from which Angel Falls plunges 979 meters

name: Llullaillaco
hint: One of the highest historically active volcanoes, with Inca mummies found near its summit
